skill.name: intent-analyzer
skill.description: Advanced intent interpretation system that analyzes user requests using cognitive science principles and extrapolates logical volition. Use when user requests are ambiguous, when deeper understanding would improve response quality, or when helping users clarify what they truly need. Applies probabilistic intent mapping, first principles decomposition, and Socratic clarification to transform vague requests into well-understood goals.
skill.summary: Advanced intent interpretation system that analyzes user requests using cognitive science principles...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. Static findings are false positives triggered by benign terminology (hash, reconnaissance, scan) used in intent analysis methodology context. No executable code, file access, network calls, or system commands exist.

content.user_title: Analyze user intent for clearer responses
content.value_statement: Vague user requests waste time and lead to irrelevant responses. This skill applies cognitive science to decode what users truly need. Transform ambiguous requests into actionable goals through first-principles thinking and strategic questioning.
actual_capabilities: Decompose requests into fundamental goals using first principles
Map probabilistic intent distributions across multiple interpretations
Recognize patterns in creative, analytical, technical, and learning requests
Detect explicit and implicit constraints from context clues
Apply Socratic questioning to resolve ambiguity before proceeding
Calibrate responses based on detected user expertise level
limitations: Does not access external files or execute code
Requires conversational context to detect expertise level
Cannot resolve ambiguity without user input during clarification
Does not integrate with external APIs or services

use_cases.title: Interpret vague requests
use_cases.description: Transform unclear user requests like help me with X into specific, actionable understanding before responding

use_cases.title: Reduce wasted iterations
use_cases.description: Identify missing requirements early through strategic questioning, avoiding rework on misunderstood features

use_cases.title: Discover true learning goals
use_cases.description: Uncover what students actually need by analyzing phrasing patterns and asking targeted follow-up questions

prompt_templates.title: Quick Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this request: user message. What is explicitly stated? What is implied? What interpretation has highest probability? If confidence below 80 percent, ask one clarifying question.

prompt_templates.title: Constraint Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: What constraints time, budget, expertise, audience are likely implied but not stated in this request? Ask one question to reveal the most critical unknown.

prompt_templates.title: Goal Extrapolation
prompt_templates.prompt: The user said user message. What immediate goal does this serve? What higher-order goal might they ultimately be trying to achieve? How should this affect my response approach?

prompt_templates.title: Pattern Classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify this request: user message. Is it creative, analytical, technical, learning-focused, or decision-oriented? What patterns in the phrasing support this classification?

output: Immediate interpretation: User wants help making their code better
Possible intents with probabilities: Fix specific bugs at 35 percent, optimize for performance at 25 percent, learn better practices at 20 percent, polish for presentation at 20 percent
Clarifying question needed: What aspect of your code needs improvement - functionality, performance, style, or something else?

output_examples.input: Write a summary of this article
output: Immediate interpretation: User wants key points extracted from the article
Possible intents: Prepare for a meeting, evaluate whether to read fully, extract specific information, or get quick overview
Clarifying question needed: What will you use this summary for and how long should it be?

output_examples.input: Which is better, Option A or Option B?
output: Immediate interpretation: User wants help making a decision between two options
Possible intents: Validate existing preference, understand tradeoffs thoroughly, or confirm one option is objectively better
Clarifying question needed: What criteria matter most to you in this decision?

best_practices: Ask 1-3 strategic questions max per turn - prioritize quality over quantity in clarification
Proceed when confidence exceeds 80 percent while remaining open to correction
Make assumptions explicit so users can correct misunderstandings early
anti_patterns: Over-clarifying obvious requests that do not need intent analysis
Guessing expertise level without signals - ask directly if unclear
Asking questions that do not disambiguate between competing interpretations

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It applies to any AI that interprets user requests.

faq.question: How many clarifying questions should I ask?
faq.answer: Limit to 1-3 questions per turn. Focus on questions that disambiguate between competing interpretations.

faq.question: Can I skip intent analysis for simple requests?
faq.answer: Yes. Only apply deep analysis to ambiguous, high-stakes, or complex requests. Simple, clear requests do not need reconstruction.

faq.question: How does this handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: This is a pure prompt framework with no data storage or external access. All analysis happens within the AI conversation.

faq.question: What if the user provides contradictory requirements?
faq.answer: Flag contradictions immediately and clarify before proceeding. Example: brief but comprehensive requires negotiation.

faq.question: How does this differ from standard request handling?
faq.answer: Standard handling takes requests literally. Intent analysis excavates underlying goals, unstated constraints, and true needs before responding.
